text:
Hello All,
I want to populate my email template with data from hubDB.
For each customer, i want the data in the equivalent row to show on his email version.

What is the best approach to do so ?
For example, if email address is ... show data from this table/row..

I don't know if i am complicating this more than i should, i just want to display the data from HubDB into my email with respect to the receiver. Would HIGHLY appreciate your help here as i am at a dead end.

Thank you!

Hey <@U02J1440N13>. Your best bet is the programmable email beta <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/email/hubdb-crm-objects?fbclid=IwAR3KWGLMukmyPBhlPuJ5rW7emq6C6KXO9K-C_YxteL9Brfeg6Vp60Pi_Uys>
This means i should add the contact property in a column and filter with respect to it? Are you aware of any real life sample that i can refer to ?
One of the code samples here <https://github.com/HubSpot/Sample-Programmable-Email-Module-Code/blob/main/samples/recruiting-example.html>
Because of the limits on table rows returned by `hubdb_table_rows` its best to be as specific as possible with the queries passed
In your case, if its is only one row, just use `hubdb_table_row`

<@U9KA594Q3> For me, i want to show all rows that have email = ""
Sorry here i meant email = to specific provided email****
Can you link me to the email?
My template is in my HubSpot account, any fast way to share it with you ?

Hey all,

*Context:*
I'm getting a list of custom objects using the crm_associations function on a membership page
Then I selecteattr 2 times, var_1 to get type "A", and var_2 to get type "C". The intent is to exclude type "B". _<- returns the expected results_
I then join var_1 and var_2 using |union and assign it to "var_joined" _<- returns expected result_
Then we attempt to loop through the var_joined|sort(false. false, "type")

*The result* is that no data is printed.
Checking the type of var_joined returns null, and checking is iterable returns false.

*The kicker:*
This is only happening to a few of contacts, not all of themâ€¦
Is anyone else experiencing or have seen this before?
